JanZernisch

Software Engineer · Agile Coach

I help companies delight their customers with digital products.

My offering includes Web-Development (with a focus on backend), Technical Consulting and Agile Coaching.

About

Software Development

My focus is on the backend development of web applications with Ruby and Python. Sustainable quality is important to me, and I rely on concepts such as TDD, SOLID and hexagonal architecture. Cooperation with domain experts is of course essential, and I find Domain Driven Design particularly helpful in this regard.

Agile Coaching

I support organizations to become more "agile". I have an ideology-free, pragmatic view of agility and my operational background helps me to understand the challenges of complex domains such as product development and to address them appropriately.

What others say

Take a look at the recommendations section on my LinkedIn profile.

Experience

Senior Software Engineer

PwC Deutschland GmbH

Chatbot platform as a service for the 12,000 employees of PwC Germany, which makes it possible to provide a new chatbot for a given context with minimal effort. Technologies: Python/RASA and Docker/Kubernetes, powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence.

January 2022 - September 2022

Agile Coach

PwC Deutschland GmbH

Organizational development and coaching. Development of a value stream-based organization, promotion of business agility, introduction of OKRs and Kanban Flight Levels. Team coaching, individual coaching for Scrum Master and Product Owner, leadership coaching.

March 2020 - October 2021

Senior Consultant Digital Transformation

Valtech Mobility

Digital solutions for the connected car. Agile coach for software development teams.

January 2019 - December 2020

Senior Software Engineer and Scrum Master

InVision AG

Building "injixo", a software solution for call center forecasting and shift planning. Building a fully automated forecasting engine for call volumes based on machine learning.

July 2011 - November 2018

Software Engineer

Research Institute for Discrete Mathematics, University of Bonn

Conception and Implementation of algorithms for designing VLSI microchips, especially for the so-called "port-assignment problem".

April 2009 - October 2010
